docs.lead_paragraph: Yahoo should call Microsoft's bluff, Breakingviews says.
docs.abstract: Yahoo should call Microsoft's bluff, Breakingviews says. The publication concedes that that may sound like a churlish suggestion given the software behemoth's apparent disdain for its onetime Internet sweetheart. But, it says, everyone continues to lose ground to Google in search. Yahoo says it could put an end to that if it just had scale. [...]

docs.snippet: President-elect Barack Obama released the list of donors to his inaugural committee on Monday, and they included  noteworthy names  like  the movie director George Lucas and Eric Schmidt, the chief executive of Google.     Out of the 1,777 people ...
docs.lead_paragraph: President-elect Barack Obama released the list of donors to his inaugural committee on Monday, and they included noteworthy names like the movie director George Lucas and Eric Schmidt, the chief executive of Google. Out of the 1,777 people who contributed a total of $1.2 million, more than 130 gave the maximum contribution of $5,000. In capping donations at that amount, Mr. Obama's aides have said they are trying to reduce the influence of big money in the festivities.

headline.main: YouTube and Ning Just Say No to Sex

docs.snippet: Microsoft's new online head, Qi Lu, is an engineer. It suggests the company is trying to copy Google's engineer-driven culture....
docs.lead_paragraph: The choice of Qi Lu to run Microsoft's online services division offers the clearest picture yet about Steven A. Ballmer's vision for the company's online effort. Its colors are blue, red, yellow and green and it is spelled G-O-O-G-L-E.
docs.abstract: Microsoft's new online head, Qi Lu, is an engineer. It suggests the company is trying to copy Google's engineer-driven culture.

docs.snippet: In trying to rate cellphones, Consumer Reports has tackled an impossible job....
docs.lead_paragraph: An article in the January issue of Consumer Reports , "Best & Worst Cell Phone Deals," has designated the Samsung Blackjack II the best smartphone made, ahead of the most popular phone on the market, the iPhone (ranked No. 10), and the new T-Mobile G1 Google Phone (No. 11). The highest-rated BlackBerry was the Pearl (No. 13).

headline.main: The Best Smartphone Is … the Blackjack?

docs.abstract: In trying to rate cellphones, Consumer Reports has tackled an impossible job.

docs.snippet: Taking a virtual stroll through the LIFE Archives on Google....
docs.lead_paragraph: The stupendous photos of Life magazine need no longer merely yellow and crumble in your grandpa's cardboard boxes. The vast archive is now available, digitized and lovely, on Google, which is increasingly assuming the role of public trust. It's all searchable, and any good citizen should set aside an hour to tour around.
docs.abstract: Taking a virtual stroll through the LIFE Archives on Google.

docs.snippet: World | A piracy expert goes back to the 16th century to identify five factors common to successful pirates, including Somalia's: "an available population of potential recruits, a secure base of operations, a sophisticated organization, some degre...
docs.lead_paragraph: World | A piracy expert goes back to the 16th century to identify five factors common to successful pirates, including Somalia's: "an available population of potential recruits, a secure base of operations, a sophisticated organization, some degree of outside support, and cultural bonds that engender vibrant group solidarity." But a retired admiral doubts the "alleged nexus" between piracy and terrorism. (See also this global, Google-enabled "Live Piracy Map 2008") [Proceedings, U.S. Naval Institute]

headline.main: The 5 Habits of Highly Successful Pirates

docs.abstract: World | A piracy expert goes back to the 16th century to identify five factors common to successful pirates, including Somalia's: "an available population of potential recruits, a secure base of operations, a sophisticated organization, some degree of outside support, and cultural bonds that engender vibrant group solidarity." [Proceedings, U.S. Naval Institute]

docs.snippet: THIS WEEK'S RECOMMENDATIONS     TEST AND LEARN: I don't know what the future holds, but let's admit that people might not always turn to daily broadsheets for their news. Among the inventive new ways of envisioning information, Newser.com is the o...
docs.lead_paragraph: THIS WEEK'S RECOMMENDATIONS TEST AND LEARN: I don't know what the future holds, but let's admit that people might not always turn to daily broadsheets for their news. Among the inventive new ways of envisioning information, Newser.com is the one I like best: its images are the right size, and it allows you to set your news preferences from hard (Ben Bernanke) to soft (Suri Cruise). Google's NewsWorldMap.com, which shows news breaking out all over the globe, is addictive. Also interesting: the brilliant experiment under way at tenbyten.org, global live broadcasts at LiveNewsCameras.com and the news-is-candy visual showcase at ThePhotostream.com.

docs.snippet: In search of more users, Google takes the "beta" label off of Chrome....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google made a splash when it announced its new Web browser, Chrome, in September. Like many of Google's new products, Chrome first appeared in a beta, or test, version. That limited its appeal, as corporate users in particular tend to shy away from using software that is still in test mode. Perhaps as a result, Chrome's share of the Web browser market is less than 1 percent. In the new browser wars, that's a rounding error compared with Internet Explorer's nearly 70 percent market share.
docs.abstract: In search of more users, Google takes the "beta" label off of Chrome.

docs.snippet: The net neutrality debate is not over whether there will be first class and coach seats, but how those seats will be priced and who will pay for them....
docs.lead_paragraph: Let's not lose sight of this: There really is a war going on between the phone companies and Google over the way Internet traffic will be priced. And both sides want their self interest to appear to be morally superior.

headline.main: Google's 'Treat All Rich Companies the Same' Vision of Net Neutrality

docs.snippet: The Bagger has put the crank in the side of the machine lately and, um, produced quite a bit of copy. The immersion, though, has left him unable to unhitch from the Oscar grid. Just this afternoon, he found himself perusing Life magazine's Academy...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger has put the crank in the side of the machine lately and, um, produced quite a bit of copy. The immersion, though, has left him unable to unhitch from the Oscar grid. Just this afternoon, he found himself perusing Life magazine's Academy Award archives, which recently became available on Google. It's a sickness, this creeping Oscar jones, but you could do worse than stare at an image of Grace Kelly and Clark Gable at the 26th annual back in 1954. Movies stars seemed more like, um, movie stars back then.

docs.snippet: In a cost-cutting move, Google gives Dream phones instead of cash as year-end gift to employees....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google has cut its year-end bonuses, but by not nearly as much as the technology gossip site Valleywag reported on Monday. Valleywag's report was later repeated by other news outlets. Google's year-end gift to most of its more than 20,000 employees worldwide will be an unlocked Dream, the first mobile phone based on Google's Android software, which is made by HTC and sold in the United States by T-Mobile under the name G1.
docs.abstract: In a cost-cutting move, Google gives Dream phones instead of cash as year-end gift to employees.

docs.snippet: The challenges of getting the new Yahoo Mail out the door are emblematic of the company's struggles in 2008....
docs.lead_paragraph: It's no secret that this has been a tough year for Yahoo. For investors, the company's two major setbacks were the failed merger negotiations with Microsoft and the failed advertising partnership with Google, which disintegrated in the face of opposition from advertisers and the Justice Department. For many employees, much of the pain came from two rounds of layoffs, seemingly endless rounds of reorganizations and a sense that they were riding on a rudderless ship.
docs.abstract: The challenges of getting the new Yahoo Mail out the door are emblematic of the company's struggles in 2008.

docs.snippet: Cooking videos offer more than just recipes, but fascinating tips and tidbits to inspire healthy home cooking....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Web has opened up a whole new world for foodies and, as regular readers of the Well blog know, cooking at home can be fun and healthful. There are great cooking blogs, easy-to-search recipe sites and search engines like Google to keep cooks well supplied in new ideas for the kitchen.
docs.abstract: Cooking videos offer more than just recipes, but fascinating tips and tidbits to inspire healthy home cooking.
